title: Daily routine 1
sentences: a las siete de la mañana.
Normally I wake up at seven in the morning.
It's very hard for me to get up when it's cold.
Primero voy al baño y me
First I go to the bathroom and wash my face with cold water.
I like to shower with very hot water.
After the shower, I dry myself with a clean towel.
I always brush my teeth after having breakfast.
frente al espejo antes de salir.
I comb my hair in front of the mirror before leaving.
My father shaves every two days.
It takes me ten minutes to get dressed in the morning.
los zapatos justo antes de salir de casa.
I put on my shoes just before leaving the house.
What time do you normally have breakfast?
un café solo antes de trabajar.
I usually have/take a black coffee before working.
I prepare a toast with oil and salt.
de casa a las ocho y cuarto.
I leave/head out from home at eight-fifteen.
el autobús para ir al centro.
I have to catch the bus to go to the center.
puntual a mi puesto de trabajo.
I always arrive on time to my workplace.
I start working at nine o'clock sharp.
a las once para tomar un té.
I take a break at eleven to have a tea.
A las dos de la tarde me toca
At two in the afternoon it's my turn to have lunch.
en la oficina con mis compañeros.
I almost always eat in the office with my colleagues.
After eating, I like to rest a bit.
I go back to work and check my emails.
I have an important meeting at four.
In the afternoon I feel a bit more tired.
Sometimes I have a snack (merienda) of a piece of fruit.
Salgo del trabajo y voy directo al
I leave work and go straight to the gym.
con mis amigos después de las clases.
I meet with my friends after classes.
en el supermercado de mi barrio.
I do the shopping at my neighborhood supermarket.
I get home and take off my shoes right away.
Finally I finish all my tasks of the day.
dictionary:
Despertarse - To wake up
Levantarse - To get up
Lavarse - To wash oneself
Ducharse - To shower
Secarse - To dry oneself
Cepillarse - To brush (teeth/hair)
Peinarse - To comb one's hair
Afeitarse - To shave
Vestirse - To get dressed
Ponerse - To put on (clothes/shoes)
Desayunar - To have breakfast
Tomar - To have / take
La tostada - The toast
Marcharse - To leave / head out
Coger - To catch / take (transport)
Llegar - To arrive
Trabajar - To work
La pausa - The break
Almorzar - To have lunch
Comer - To eat / have lunch
Descansar - To rest
Revisar - To check / review
La reunión - The meeting
Sentirse - To feel
Merendar - To have a snack
El gimnasio - The gym
Encontrarse con - To meet with
La compra - The shopping
Quitarse - To take off (clothes)
Terminar - To finish
